ManagerScene2: ^I can’t say I’m ecstatic to see you.
^I just have a few more questions for you.
^Whatever I say, you’ll use it to help Nadine. So why should I say anything at all?

s: ^She didn’t give me this much trouble last time…*

c-0: ^You want to find the real culprit, don’t you?
^And if it isn’t? You’ll just let the real killer go free?
^What are you trying to say? I don’t have time to be playing games with you.
^What I‘m trying to say is this: we may be on different sides, but we have the same goal
^We’re trying to convict the real killer of Madeline Bain.
^Any information you share with me will help us get closer to that.
^Because if the killer is truly Nadine Kanna, won’t the evidence point towards her?
^Kaylee cocks her head to the side.
^Well then? Go on. What are your questions?

OfficeAccessAnswer: ^No one has access to our office besides Madeline and me.
^I suppose you could say security as well, since they have the master key.
MakeupRoomAccessAnswer: ^Who had access to the makeup room during the night of the Gala?
^Only related personnel. They would have to use the ID scanner to get in.
^So that means the makeup artists, hair stylists, managers, and the celebrities assigned to that room.
^No, of course not! That would pose a security risk.
^These are high-profile celebrities we’re talking about. Don’t be ridiculous.
KayleeQuestioningOver: ^See. I told you. It would be quick.
^I’ll see you in court, Ms. Nyugen.
